content:
Congratulations on your new job and establishing a consistent wake-up time!

I'd be happy to help you fit in a 30-minute workout session during the week. Considering your lunch break is at 12:30 PM and you take a short break at 2:00 PM, here are a few options to squeeze in a workout:

**Option 1: Morning Workout (6:30 AM - 7:00 AM)**
You're already waking up at 6:30 AM, so why not use the first 30 minutes to fit in a quick workout? This way, you'll get it out of the way before starting your workday. You can try a quick HIIT (High-Intensity Interval Training) session, yoga, or a brisk walk/jog.

**Option 2: Lunch Break Workout (12:00 PM - 12:30 PM)**
Use the 30 minutes leading up to your lunch break to fit in a workout. You can try a quick strength training circuit, a 30-minute walk, or even a lunch-break yoga session. This way, you'll get your workout in and still have time to grab lunch and relax before heading back to work.

**Option 3: Afternoon Break Workout (2:00 PM - 2:30 PM)**
Take advantage of your short break at 2:00 PM to fit in a quick workout. You can try a 30-minute walk, some stretching exercises, or even a quick HIIT session. This can help you refocus and energize for the rest of the workday.

**Option 4: Split Your Workout**
If you can't fit in a full 30-minute workout during the day, consider splitting it into two shorter sessions. For example, you could do 15 minutes in the morning (6:30 AM - 6:45 AM) and another 15 minutes during your lunch break (12:15 PM - 12:30 PM) or afternoon break (2:00 PM - 2:15 PM).

Choose the option that works best for your schedule and energy levels. Remember to listen to your body and adjust your workout routine accordingly. It's great that you're prioritizing your fitness, and even a short workout session can make a positive impact on your day!
